Package org.jlab.coda.hipo

Class FileHeader

java.lang.Object
org.jlab.coda.hipo.FileHeader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
public class FileHeader extends Object implements Cloneable
This class represents the file header of an evio or hipo format file. 
 

 FILE HEADER STRUCTURE ( 56 bytes, 14 integers (32 bit) )

    +----------------------------------+
  1 |              ID                  | // HIPO: 0x43455248, Evio: 0x4556494F
    +----------------------------------+
  2 +          File Number             | // split file #
    +----------------------------------+
  3 +         Header Length            | // 14 (words)
    +----------------------------------+
  4 +      Record (Index) Count        |
    +----------------------------------+
  5 +      Index Array Length          | // bytes
    +-----------------------+----------+
  6 +       Bit Info        | Version  | // version (8 bits)
    +-----------------------+----------+
  7 +      User Header Length          | // bytes
    +----------------------------------+
  8 +          Magic Number            | // 0xc0da0100
    +----------------------------------+
  9 +          User Register           | 
    +--                              --+
 10 +                                  |
    +----------------------------------+
 11 +         Trailer Position         | // File offset to trailer head (64 bits).
    +--                              --+ // 0 = no offset available or no trailer exists.
 12 +                                  |
    +----------------------------------+
 13 +          User Integer 1          |
    +----------------------------------+
 14 +          User Integer 2          |
    +----------------------------------+

 -------------------
   Bit Info Word
 -------------------
     0-7  = version
     8    = true if dictionary is included
     9    = true if this file has "first" event (in every split file)
    10    = File trailer with index array of record lengths exists
    11-19 = reserved
    20-21 = pad 1
    22-23 = pad 2
    24-25 = pad 3 (always 0)
    26-27 = reserved
    28-31 = general header type: 1 = Evio file
                                 2 = Evio extended file
                                 5 = HIPO file
                                 6 = HIPO extended file
Since:
6.0 9/6/17
Version:
6.0
Author:
gavalian, timmer

    • setBitInfo

      public int setBitInfo(boolean haveFirst, boolean haveDictionary, boolean haveTrailerWithIndex)
      Set the bit info word for a file header. Retains current header type, user header length padding, and version.
      Parameters:
      haveFirst - true if file has first event.
      haveDictionary - true if file has dictionary in user header.
      haveTrailerWithIndex - true if file has trailer with record length index.
      Returns:
      new bit info word.

    • setIndexLength

      public FileHeader setIndexLength(int length)
      Set the length of the index array in bytes. Length is forced to be a multiple of 4! Sets the total length too.
      Parameters:
      length - length of index array in bytes.
      Returns:
      this object.

    • setEntries

      public FileHeader setEntries(int n)
      Set the number of record entries. No compression for other values.
      Parameters:
      n - number of record entries.
      Returns:
      this object.

    • setUserHeaderLength

      public FileHeader setUserHeaderLength(int length)
      Set the user-defined header's length in bytes and words and the padding. Sets the total length too.
      Parameters:
      length - user-defined header's length in bytes.
      Returns:
      this object.

    • setHeaderLength

      public FileHeader setHeaderLength(int length)
      Set the this header's length in bytes and words. Minimum length of 56 (14 words) is enforced. If length is not a multiple of 4, you're on your own! Sets the total length too.
      Parameters:
      length - this header's length in bytes.
      Returns:
      this object.

    • setLength

      public FileHeader setLength(int length)
      Set the total length in bytes, header + index + user header. This includes padding and is on a 4-byte boundary. Never compressed.
      Parameters:
      length - total length in bytes, header + index + user header.
      Returns:
      this object.

    • writeHeader

      public void writeHeader(ByteBuffer buf, int off) throws HipoException
      Writes the file (not record!) header into the given byte buffer.
      Parameters:
      buf - byte buffer to write file header into.
      off - position in buffer to begin writing.
      Throws:
      HipoException - if buffer is null or contains too little room.

    • writeHeader

      public void writeHeader(ByteBuffer buffer) throws HipoException
      Writes the file (not record!) header into the given byte buffer starting at beginning.
      Parameters:
      buffer - byte buffer to write file header into.
      Throws:
      HipoException - if buffer is null or contains too little room.

    • readHeader

      public void readHeader(ByteBuffer buffer, int offset) throws HipoException
      Reads the file header information from a byte buffer and validates it by checking the magic word (8th word). This magic word also determines the byte order. The given buffer's position does NOT change.
      Parameters:
      buffer - buffer to read from.
      offset - position of first word to be read.
      Throws:
      HipoException - if buffer is null, remaining buffer space (limit - off) is too small, data is not in proper format, or version earlier than 6.

    • readHeader

      public void readHeader(ByteBuffer buffer) throws HipoException
      Reads the file header information from a byte buffer and validates it by checking the magic word (8th word). This magic word also determines the byte order. The given buffer's position does NOT change.
      Parameters:
      buffer - buffer to read from starting at the beginning.
      Throws:
      HipoException - if buffer is not in the proper format or earlier than version 6

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the record.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the record.

      public static void byteBufferBinaryString(ByteBuffer buffer)

      Parameters:
